technology.short_description: These intricate designs are woven from strips cut from the pelts of young beasts, perhaps slain for the tenderness of their meat.

effects.description: Speed: +4% for Snow Leopard units
Weapon strength: +9% for Snow Leopard and Things in the Woods units

technology.short_description: Time dedicated purely to rest, but also knowledge of healing herbs and the methods needed to extract the best from them, are key to a casualty's survival.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +3%
Growth: +10

technology.short_description: Survival in the barren, inhospitable Oblasts requires stamina and tenacity found in few other men.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Income from post-battle loot: +10%

Corruption: -1
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: It takes complex machinery, the keenest eye and considerable skill to fashion lenses good enough for use in high-grade telescopes and spy-glasses.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +25% for all settlements and characters
Magic item drop chance from battle: +8%

technology.short_description: Ceremonies such as these are crucial when living so close to Chaos Wastes, lest the Ruinous Ones insidious corruption infect and disrupt the land.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: -20%
	(all armies)

Seduce Units budget: -30%
	(Slaaneshi armies in your regions)

technology.short_description: This ingenious design not only enables efficient deflection of blows, but can also be hooked around an opponent's shield or haul a rider from their mount.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units
Melee defence: +5 for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi and Akshina Ambushers units

technology.short_description: A city that has withstood near-constant beleaguerment throughout its history produces citizens of a particular mindset – always ready to take up the life-or-death struggle once more.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 when under siege
Ammunition: +15%
Reload time reduction: +10% when under siege

technology.short_description: Hides and skins are tanned to protect and make them more durable in the harsh, northern conditions.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Horse Archers, Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units

technology.short_description: An important skill for acolytes of the Ice Court is learning to carve and shape its abundance through manipulation of the highly-volatile Ice Magic.

effects.description: Unlocks an Ice Court training slot for Frost Maiden Heroes
Hero capacity: +1 for Frost Maidens

technology.short_description: The Ice Witches, by use of their most-dangerous magic, can construct great geometries to range and direct their devastating magical attacks.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15
	(all armies)
Ammunition: +15% for Ice Guard

technology.short_description: A central tenet of the Orthodoxy is the unification of disparate old beliefs into one formal canon, to shelter against the influence of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Patriarchs
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Patriarchs

technology.short_description: The Cursed City is home to the Great Orthodoxy, whose Grand Patriarch leads the faithful from the path of madness and mutation.

effects.description: Orthodoxy Support gained: +1 per turn
Hero action success chance: +5% for Patriarchs
Hero action cost: -10% for Patriarchs

technology.short_description: The formidable league of port merchants exercise the real power over the great city's economic growth.

effects.description: Attrition: -2% casualties suffered from all attrition
Tradable resources produced: +8%

technology.short_description: Better telescopic aids provided by Astromancers of the Empire allow those stationed in Praag’s northern watchtowers to issue an earlier warning should Chaos invaders return.

effects.description:
Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: Stone quarried from the mineral-rich shores of the Iron River is of vastly superior quality, so supply must be kept constant if the city is to expand at pace.

effects.description: Construction cost: -8% for resource-producing buildings
Construction cost: -4% for all buildings

technology.short_description: "Lest we forget those who lost their minds and lives to the Dark Gods' terrible advance…"

effects.description:
Corruption: -3
	(all provinces)

technology.short_description: In the Endless Steppes, nothing will grow in the grip of winter, so preserving food for the long haul is not just practical, but essential.

effects.description: Growth: +10 in settlements with Frozen climates
Casualty replenishment rate: +2%
Control: +1

technology.short_description: Those who lose their way while traversing Troll Country tend to end up dead. Some men of Kislev have spent their lives learning all the safe routes through the region.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +5%
	(all armies)
Speed: +15% for Akshina Ambushers units
Range: +10% for Akshina Ambushers units

technology.short_description: Every fearful Kislevite knows that wary steps and a keen eye is best supplemented with a reliable charm.

effects.description:
Campaign line of sight: +50%
	(all characters)
Magic item drop chance from battle: +20%

Spell resistance: 10%
	(all armies)

technology.short_description:
For those who offer the correct level of respect, the forest provides a path.
	
	Those who do not are never heard of or seen again...

effects.description: Attribute: Snipe for Akshina Ambushers

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: -15% for enemy armies starting their turn in your regions
Campaign movement range: +5%

Speed: +10%
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Many monsters take the shape of common animals, but reveal their forms of mist and shadow just as the axe falls.

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Things in the Woods and Forest Animal units
Bonus vs Infantry: +8 for Cave Bat units

technology.short_description: Proof that your line extends from the noble Gospodars gives a distinct advantage in every quarter of Kislevite life.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +3
Hero recruit rank: +3

technology.short_description: Ever since they sacked Erengrad, levelling much of the city and slaughtering a large proportion of the populace, it's an understatement to say that the survivors have no love for the barbaric Norsemen.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen
Melee defence: +4 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen
Attribute: Immune to Psychology when fighting Daemons of Chaos, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Beastmen and Norsca

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: The Old World's second-largest trading port provides safe berthing to pirates and privateers in return for knowledge of foreign martial advances.

effects.description: Range: +10% for Kislev pistol units
Base missile damage: -6 for Kislev pistol units
Armour-piercing missile damage: +6 for Kislev pistol units

technology.short_description: These men, of ancient Ungol blood, are the hardened masters of war in the vast Oblasts.

effects.description: Melee defence: +3 when defending
Base missile damage: +2 for Kossars, Horse Archers and Akshina Ambushers

technology.short_description: The added downforce provided by these upright wooden bracings makes for much sturdier sleds which are far less likely to overturn during swift manoeuvres on the ice.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for War Sleds and Little Grom units

technology.short_description: Just as it empowers the blades of the Ice Guard’s warrior women, the strength of winter’s fury can also benefit Kislev’s more ungifted men.

effects.description: Enables magical attacks for Boyars, Atamans and Druzhina
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +50 for Boyars, Atamans and Druzhina

technology.short_description: Layered upon the armour of the Ice Guard and maintained by their own magical talent, these wards deflect incoming blows with deadly bursts of ice.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Permafrost Wards" for Ice Guard units
Armour: +15 for Ice Guard units

technology.short_description: Righteous fervour buoys those who have yet to be bloodied and turns ploughshares into swords.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Kislevite Warriors, Kossars, Kossovite Dervishes and Horse Archers units
Melee defence: +4 for all units (Rank 3 and below)
Melee attack: +4 for all units (Rank 3 and below)

technology.short_description: Praag’s Witch Hunters are as zealous as their Empire counter-parts due to the city’s troubled history. Additional assemblies will see more heretics rooted out.

effects.description: The Power of the Church commandment: additional -2 corruption reduction
Control: +1

technology.short_description: The harbour master is responsible for all aspects of customs and excise, right the way down to the tariffs and duties levied upon foreign traders.

effects.description: Attrition: -2% casualties suffered from all attrition
Income from trade tariffs: +10%

technology.short_description: Renovating the vast abandoned wings of the Bokha Palace will provide additional accommodation to barrack many rotas of loyal soldiers.

effects.description: Relief Columns commandment: additional -4% to recruitment cost

technology.short_description: The ability to exchange the differing coinage of the Old World’s many nations will give Erengrad an advantage over other port-cities.

effects.description: Construction cost: -2% for all buildings
Awaken the Land commandment: additional 2% income
+1 Allied Recruitment Unit capacity per army

technology.short_description: Angering the great beasts just enough to make them aggressive, but not so much that they kill you, is a valuable skill to master.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Frenzy" for War Bear Rider and War Sleds units

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Forming deep gorges to build up ice into great shards, or planting lots of iron-briars and sharp, thorny scrub, ensures the elemental guardians are created with bite.

effects.description: Melee attack: +8 for Frost Wyrm, Elemental Bear and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units

technology.short_description: Upon which the unwary are dashed by hoof, steel and arrow.

effects.description: Ambush success chance: +20%
Bonus vs Infantry: +8 for Kossovite Dervishes and Horse Archers

technology.short_description: Where the theory of magick is practised indeed.

effects.description: Witch's Hut secondary trinket slots: +1

technology.short_description: It is thought the natural state of affairs that the more civilised southern tribe should rule over the simple peoples of the north.

effects.description: Construction cost: -15% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: This gathering is an important date in the Ungol Calendar upon which the strength of the Bear God and the protection He gives the common folk of Kislev is celebrated city-wide.

effects.description:
Corruption: -2
	(all provinces)

Control: +2
	(all provinces)

Leadership: +2 for Infantry units
	(all armies)

technology.short_description: Ever on a war footing lest the Dark Gods turn their Ruinous gaze upon Praag once more, the elite guard store many of their black powder rifles here, for the call to existential conflict may come at any moment.

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +6 for Streltsi units
Ammunition: +15% for Streltsi and War Sleds units

technology.short_description: If you want the very best smithing equipment, there's only really one race to buy from; for the Dwarfs, such things are in their very blood.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Kislev Horse Cavalry units

technology.short_description: Several layers of finely-wrought, ultra-thin metal skin, bound together, provide the strength to withstand axe or hammer blows, and deflect arrow or spear points when launched acutely.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +10% for Kossars, Armoured Kossars, Kislevite Warriors, Streltsi, Akshina Ambushers and Ice Guard units

technology.short_description: The youth of Erengrad's induction into the Ice Court is a fraught mixture of ancient pride and novel ways to embroil oneself in dangerous intrigue.

effects.description: Ice Court Support gained: +1 per turn
Hero capacity: +1 for Frost Maidens
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Frost Maidens

technology.short_description: Duty to Kislev hardens the resolve of the Tzar Guard, the unbreakable core that anchors the Kislevite battle lines.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Tzar Guard units
Attribute: Charge Defence vs Large for Tzar Guard units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

technology.short_description: Under Kostaltyn, the Orthodoxy has adopted a passionate and fiery rhetoric that inflames the heart and steadies the soul.

effects.description: Effect duration: +25% for Kislevite Battle Prayers
Orthodoxy Support gained: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: When the order comes down, there is no possible reason to avoid duty that would not be considered a dishonourable and shameful shirking of responsibility.

effects.description: Orthodoxy Support gained: +1 per turn
Local recruitment capacity: +1
Global recruitment capacity: +2

technology.short_description: The minutiae of these regulations ensure that Erengrad's port is run in the most efficient way possible.

effects.description: Income from Ports: +10%

technology.short_description: The positioning of sizeable gabions allows for the swift construction and rearrangement of Erengrad's coastal defences, so gun emplacements and forts can be scaled up or down according to the level of threat faced.

effects.description: Defensive supplies: +500
Kislevite Ports generate significantly more Defensive Supplies

technology.short_description: Men able to accumulate ducats are truly the major players among the city's burgeoning merchant class.

effects.description: Income from Province Capital/Settlement buildings: +20%

technology.short_description: A fertile Motherland – fortified by crop rotation and lots of bear manure – will provide a replenished spirit should the elements be called to the nation’s defence.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Frost Wyrm, Elemental Bear and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units

technology.short_description: When the threat of Chaos looms, the desperate turn to myth for succour. And she provides – at a cost.

effects.description: Growth: -10

Physical resistance: 10%
	(all characters)

technology.short_description: Spirits of ancient and loyal War Bears are drawn to carved Ur-stones that are planted in the ground to power the elemental force that protects the Motherland.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Frost Wyrm, Elemental Bear and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units

technology.short_description: Those who awaken from deep sleep sometimes find marks upon their bodies with no apparent cause, and always they blame the little spiders...

effects.description: Spider units cause "Slow Death" effect, draining hit points
Attribute: Causes Terror for Spider units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

technology.short_description: Like a roiling wave of terror, the call of the forest is the sign to lock your doors twice, salt your windowsills and to close your ears to the voices...

effects.description:
Things in the Woods Attacks cause "Discouraged" effect, reducing leadership 
	 (Excludes the Mordheim Balewolves)
Missile resistance: 15% for Things in the Woods units

technology.short_description: Those who take without remorse are irrevocably marked, each stain a siren call to the spirits who prepare for the reaping.

effects.description: enables unlimited forest spotting range.
In battles, enemy units in forests are revealed regardless of distance
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +100 for Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units

technology.short_description: Those who dare, endure.

effects.description: Immune to Mountain attrition
Immune to Chaos Wastes attrition

technology.short_description: Once fully indoctrinated, members of the Ice Court are put on a path of absolute certainty in their cause. While it makes them... peculiar, it sharpens their focus wonderfully.

effects.description: Unlocks an Ice Court training slot for Ice Witch Lords
Ice Court Support gained: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: Special rites, taught by the Ice Witches, set an especially tough permafrost on the land – an armoured sheen for the elements.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 10% for Frost Wyrm, Elemental Bear and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units
Physical resistance: 10% for Frost Wyrm, Elemental Bear and Incarnate Elemental of Beasts units

technology.short_description: Banners warded with divine favour ensure that Kislev's warriors always have more than a fighting chance.

items.colour_text: Warded with sanctioned and divine prayer, this banner grants spirit and will to the Kislevites who fight under it.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8
	(assigned unit)

Enables magical attacks
	(assigned unit)

technology.short_description: The Kislevite folk are hardy, and the fervour of the Orthodoxy does nothing to quell this determined spirit.

effects.description: Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
Enemy Hero action success chance: -20%

technology.short_description: The Guild ensures that goods and money flow freely from the ports into the heart of the city, and the right people profit.

effects.description: Growth: +15

technology.short_description: They may seem like soft southerners, unworthy of comradeship, but the Empire's vast resources – and therefore its friendship – are essential if Kislev is to guard the northern marches from Ruin.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Empire
Allegiance points gained: +10%

technology.short_description: The Empire has developed many production processes to their optimal effectiveness, but security is lax, or at least insufficient to prevent enterprising Kislevites 'borrowing' the best of them…

effects.description: Upkeep: -2%
Income from all buildings: +4%
Melee defence: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.short_description: Something wicked definitely this way comes.

effects.description: Witch's Hut secondary trinket slots: +1

technology.short_description: There are many scientific intricacies that govern effective arms-craft; Little Grom can be adjusted and primed for maximum efficiency as well as devastation.

effects.description: Range: +15% for Little Grom units

technology.short_description: Give a man a spear and he may run; give him a spear, a gun, and some idea of how to use them and you have the beginnings of a useful, even professional, port patrol service.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Infantry and Cavalry units

technology.short_description: Kislev's elite fighting force are the keepers of the specialist martial knowledge which sets them well apart from their nearest rivals.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Winged Lancer and Gryphon Legion units
Charge bonus: +5% for Kossovite Dervishes, Winged Lancers and Gryphon Legion units
Charge bonus: +8 for Winged Lancer and Gryphon Legion units

technology.short_description: Candidates for full membership of the Ice Court must be sought and instructed in its myriad customs and rites if the next generation of Ice Maidens and Witches is to rise.

effects.description: Ice Court Support gained: +1 per turn

Character experience gain: +15%
	(all characters)

Wound recovery time: -1 turns
	(all characters)

technology.short_description: A lifetime of training instils the absolute loyalty demanded of the Ice Guard to put their lives before those of Kislev’s royalty.

effects.description: Upkeep: -10% for armies led by Ice Witches and Tzarina Katarin
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Ice Guard units

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Spirits dance at their summoners command, harnessing a deadly strength that mortal bodies could only envy.

effects.description: Unlocks the empowered "Recreant Spirit" Hex

technology.short_description: The secrets of chemistry learned in the distant East bring Little Grom's explosive anger to fiery, corporeal life.

effects.description: Ammunition: +15% for War Sleds and Little Grom units
"Explosive" ammunition switch for Little Grom units

technology.short_description: It is certainly an advance, by virtue of being both faster and many magnitudes less dangerous, to load firearms at the opposite end to their muzzles.

effects.description: Armour-piercing missile damage: +2 for Kislev gunpowder units
Range +10% for Kislev gunpowder units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Kislev gunpowder units

technology.short_description: It is only right that those who serve as the Tzar's bodyguard are proven loyal beyond doubt.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Tzar Guard units
Melee defence: +5 for Tzar Guard units
Attribute: Encourage for Tzar Guard units

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

technology.short_description: "In this great battle for our very souls, there can be no exception! Every man and woman must rise and find the strength within themselves to fight and die for Kislev!"

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Kislev units
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units

technology.short_description: The Magical Forest is a dark winding labyrinth; so easy to stumble into... and near impossible to escape.

effects.description: Unlocks the empowered "Jinxed Land" Hex

technology.short_description: Weak minds are so easy to break – with the right words, whole towns blink in delusion, drawn under their new master's hypnotic sway.

effects.description: Unlocks the empowered "Bewitching Lure" Hex

technology.short_description: Like the gnarled roots of a tree breaking free from the earth, the curse twists itself from the ground, ensnaring each body in its path.

effects.description: Unlocks the empowered "Coven's Cursemark" Hex

technology.short_description: The blinding light of purity burns corruption out at its source, cleansing the land until the tendrils of wickedness will never again take root.

effects.description: Unlocks the empowered "Purification Chant" Hex
